summary: This document is a compilation of FBI 302 forms and attached responses to federal grand jury subpoenas issued by the Southern District of New York. It includes Comcast phone records for a specific number from July-August 2019, and credit reports from Equifax and Experian for an individual, all provided as part of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. This document is a response from Experian to a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, dated August 30, 2019. Experian states it cannot locate credit records for two individuals, Tova A. Noel and Michael A. Thomas, without additional identification information. The document includes the subpoena, a rider specifying the requested individuals, a declaration of custodian of records form, and extensive Experian credit report documentation and glossaries.

persons.name: AUSA MEM

persons.role: Custodian of Records at Experian Consumer Affairs
persons.context: Signs the response letter to the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the grand jury subpoena for credit records.

persons.name: AUSA Donaleski
persons.context: Addressee of Experian's response letter regarding the subpoena for credit records.

persons.name: Tova A. Noel
persons.context: Individual whose credit records are sought by the grand jury subpoena; Experian cannot locate records without more information.

persons.name: Michael A. Thomas
persons.context: Individual whose credit records are sought by the grand jury subpoena; listed on the subpoena rider.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman

connections.description: Both are attorneys with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York involved in issuing the grand jury subpoena.
Haas, as Experian's Custodian of Records, formally responds in writing to AUSA Donaleski regarding the subpoena.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: A federal grand jury subpoena was issued, signed by an AUSA, requesting records from Comcast.

events.title: Comcast Provides Phone Records
events.description: Comcast Legal Response Center faxed subscriber information and call detail records for a target phone number (908-279-6215) from July 6 to August 13, 2019, in response to the subpoena.

events.title: Equifax Provides Credit Report
events.description: Equifax provided a credit report for an individual (name redacted, SSN ending in 8558) dated September 16, 2019, in response to a records request from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued to Experian
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issues a grand jury subpoena to Experian demanding credit records for Tova A. Noel and Michael A. Thomas.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The subpoena commanded an appearance before the grand jury at the U.S. Courthouse in New York; Experian responded by letter instead.

events.title: Experian's Response to Subpoena
events.description: Experian's Custodian of Records, Rick V. Haas, sends a letter to AUSA Donaleski stating they cannot locate credit records for Tova A. Noel and Michael A. Thomas without additional identification.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
1800 Bishops Gate Boulevard, Mount Laurel, NJ 08054
New York, NY 10007 (United States Attorney's Office, One Saint Andrew's Plaza)
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, New York, NY (Grand Jury location)
keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena compelled Comcast to produce phone records for the number 908-279-6215, with a service address in North Plainfield, NJ, covering the period from July 6 to August 13, 2019.
The Comcast call detail logs show numerous short-duration calls (mostly under one minute) originating from and terminating to the target number during this period.

Equifax provided a credit report for an individual with a Social Security Number ending in 8558, which shows a medical/health care collection account from "Stern Recovery Services, Inc." for $125, first delinquent in May 2016.
The documents are FBI 302 forms used to log evidence received, indicating the phone and credit records were obtained as part of the SDNY's investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
The name of the subscriber of the target phone number and the subject of the credit report are redacted in the provided text.

A federal grand jury subpoena was issued to Experian on August 30, 2019, seeking credit records for Tova A. Noel and Michael A. Thomas as part of an investigation into alleged violations of federal law (18 U.S.C. §§ 1791, 201).
Experian responded on September 16, 2019, that it could not locate credit records for Tova A. Noel and needed additional identification information to pull records for Michael A. Thomas.
The subpoena was signed by then-U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman for the Southern District of New York.
The document includes a detailed rider specifying the individuals targeted and a declaration of custodian of records form to certify the records.
A large portion of the document consists of Experian's internal glossaries and sample credit report formats, which are standard documentation appended to their official responses.
